image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Two South Australian men are the first in the state to be found guilty after standing trial for charges arising from the major police operation.

title.children: Two SA men found guilty of charges arising from AN0M app

image.altText: Darren Letton holds a chicken. He wears a navy and yellow polo shirt. He is standing in a chicken barn.

props.synopsis: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

title.children: Egg shortage becomes egg oversupply with farmers unable to sell product

image.altText: Three four-wheel drives, including one with a white box trailer with three scuba tanks placed outside of it

props.synopsis: The body of a man who died while cave diving in South Australia's south-east on Sunday has now been recovered, police say.

title.children: Diver's body recovered after cave diving incident in SA

image.altText: The Elizabeth City Centre shopping centre during a lockdown.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors are "likely" to consider asking for the case against two teenagers charged over a stabbing — which sent an Adelaide shopping centre into lockdown — to be moved to an adult court.

title.children: Teens in court charged over Adelaide shopping centre stabbing

image.altText: Sam Kerr sits on the bench with her hands together during an Australian Matildas football match.

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr is running out of chances to make her long-awaited return from a knee injury, as the Australian team faces New Zealand's Football Ferns in their last scheduled match before next year's Asian Cup.

title.children: Sam Kerr 'in the mix' for Matildas return on Tuesday night

image.altText: An image of three young people, two female and one male, looking at mobile phones. A bright pink background is behind them.

props.synopsis: BTN surveyed more than 17,000 Australians under 16 about the federal government's upcoming social media ban. This is what they said.

title.children: What 17,000-plus young people think about the social media ban

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: An image of spiders' legs in the shape of the logo of an Adelaide high school is among several bizarre clues that have been released in the hope they could help police identify the person who is behind a series of threatening emails.

title.children: Bizarre spiders' leg threat to Adelaide school

image.altText: A woman wearing a black blazer stands with her hands in front of her

props.synopsis: Hayley Brown says she almost lost her life at the hands of a long-term partner. She is now one of the first victim-survivors to join a statewide lived experience advisory network.

title.children: Domestic violence survivor shares 'failures in the system' to spark change

image.altText: A woman stands behind the wheel of a yacht.

props.synopsis: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade says it is providing consular assistance to the family of an Australian missing in the Mozambique Channel off the coast of Africa.

title.children: Family of Port Lincoln sailor fears she has died overseas

image.altText: Hundreds of flies gather on a feeding area.

props.synopsis: Researchers on Kangaroo Island have been breeding and releasing millions of sterile Australian sheep blowflies in an attempt to eradicate the pest.

title.children: Sterile flies take to the sky in Kangaroo Island eradication push

image.altText: A graphic including a newspaper front page, image of von Einem in sunglasses and an inset photo of victim Richard Kelvin

props.synopsis: One of South Australia's most notorious murderers was this week rushed to an infirmary on the brink of death, prompting recollections of the time when young males disappeared across Adelaide in a set of gruesome crimes dubbed "The Family" murders. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: 'The Family' murders that stole Adelaide's innocence

image.altText: Unidentifiable domestic violence victim on the phone.

props.synopsis: Five women allege sexual misconduct against a Ballarat Bowen therapy business run by a father-son duo.

title.children: Five women allege sexual misconduct by father-son therapists

image.altText: People looking at burning building in Hong Kong's Wang Fuk Court.

props.synopsis: The blaze that consumed Wang Fuk Court burned for two days, but its political shock waves may echo for weeks, even months.

title.children: Hong Kong's grief meets Beijing's red lines

image.altText: A message reading "AI artificial intelligence", a keyboard, and robot hands are seen.

props.synopsis: The federal government's long-awaited National AI Plan will seek to accelerate the growth of artificial intelligence in Australia, and largely leverage existing laws to protect against its worst harms.

title.children: Government drops AI 'mandatory guardrails', reveals road map on data centres

image.altText: A generic photo of a box of Ozempic pens.

props.synopsis: Ozempic-style medications have been recommended as long-term treatments for obesity under new guidelines released by the World Health Organization.

title.children: WHO declares obesity a disease, says Ozempic can be used to treat it

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: Cryptocurrency prices continue to come under pressure, while global stocks fell and bond yields rose overnight. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street wobbles as Bitcoin continues to dive

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX on the rise in early trade
'Gentle density' could unlock a million new homes: CEDA

image.altText: A man with short hair is pictured inside an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Disability advocates say cuts to Deaf participants' NDIS funding is a "systemic" problem that reflects a belief that Deafness can be "fixed".

title.children: 'I never wanted speech therapy': Deaf man incensed by NDIS recommendation

image.altText: A man with long grey hair holds a spear in a video editing suite.

props.synopsis: Acclaimed filmmaker George Gittoes has revealed a former NT police officer told him he witnessed his colleagues taking a Yolŋu clan leader out to shoot him and dump his body in Darwin Harbour in 1934.

title.children: Filmmaker reveals eyewitness saw police allegedly murder Aboriginal clan leader

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: A landmark inquiry into sexual violence in the Australian Defence Force will be announced today. Follow live.

title.children: Government to establish landmark probe into ADF sexual violence

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'That's cooked': Greens slam government's AI plan
Long-awaited report into 'jobs for mates' released
Artificial intelligence to be managed through existing laws

image.altText: A car sits in the remains of a house that has been destroyed by flooding

props.synopsis: Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka are reeling from flooding that has killed hundreds in each country and destroyed communities.

title.children: More than 1,160 dead after extreme flooding across Asia

image.altText: An aerial view of two people standing next to hiking tents near a rocky outcrop overlooking a lake down below.

props.synopsis: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

title.children: 'Illusion of simplicity': Social media glosses over dangers of bushwalking

image.altText: Nick Morgan has a thick beard and is wearing a high-vis yellow shirt with a black cap.

props.synopsis: A home owner who lost his house and his cat to a bushfire in Geraldton, in WA's Mid West, says "karma" is looking for anyone who may have deliberately lit the blazes.

title.children: Man who lost home, cat in Geraldton bushfire trying to avoid 'anger path'

image.altText: report cover

props.synopsis: The document, prepared for the Queensland government, has been exclusively obtained by the ABC.

title.children: Secret audit reveals millions pocketed in hidden travel management deals

image.altText: A woman wearing a yellow kimono speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Historically, Japan has had numerous women monarchs. But current laws prevent the emperor's daughter from succeeding him — and politicians, including the prime minister, support the status quo.

title.children: Princess's popularity spurs calls to ditch male-only succession in Japan

image.altText: An aerial photo of a new housing estate with empty blocks and several new houses being built.

props.synopsis: The public policy think tank, CEDA, believes Australia could increase its current housing stock by nine per cent if just one in four standalone homes in the five biggest cities are developed into dual occupancies.

title.children: Overlooked solution to housing crisis could unlock a million new homes: CEDA

image.altText: 'Yes stadium' and 'No stadium' stickers composite image.

props.synopsis: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

title.children: The 'yes stadium' and 'no stadium' split still divides Tasmania

image.altText: A young man in a jacket sits in a court room

props.synopsis: Mr Mangione, who was arrested in 2024, has been charged with fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan.

title.children: Luigi Mangione's arrest videos and worker's 911 call played at hearings

image.altText: A man with a neutral expression looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: A son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin "El Chapo" pleads guilty to US drug trafficking charges, months after his brother entered a plea deal.

title.children: Son of drug kingpin 'El Chapo' pleads guilty in US drug trafficking case

image.altText: A group of sportsmen celebrate while holding a trophy

props.synopsis: R360's announcement it is not going to be ready in 2026 brings back memories of previous attempts to set up rebel sporting competitions, almost all of which have failed.

title.children: The mostly unsuccessful history of breakaway leagues as R360 postponed

image.altText: A cricketer in white holds a pink ball aloft, surrounded by clapping teammates

props.synopsis: Day-night Test cricket provides Australia with one of the most potent home advantages in the history of the sport. Ten years into its existence, these are the numbers behind the format, its best performers and the ways England could spring an upset in Brisbane.

title.children: The numbers and narrative behind Australia's staggering pink ball success

image.altText: A woman with shoulder-length brown hair speaks into a microphone while looking at someone out of frame

props.synopsis: Tulip Siddiq says the decision should be treated with "contempt", while her political party says she was not afforded due process.

title.children: 'Kangaroo court': UK MP lashes Bangladeshi court over corruption conviction

image.altText: A close-up photo of Richard Marles.

props.synopsis: Three groups within Defence will be rolled into one entity as part of a sweeping restructure of the department.

title.children: Government unveils Department of Defence overhauls amid delays, blowouts

image.altText: A hand holds a smartphone with a text message claiming to be from Australia Post, asking to arrange a 'redelivery'

props.synopsis: Organisations using branded identifiers in their text messages to consumers will need to register them by July 1, 2026, or risk being mistaken for a scam.

title.children: Businesses that send SMS messages now need to register their IDs

image.altText: Ozempic is displayed in a pharmacy in Provo

props.synopsis: Australia's medicines regulator issues a safety warning over the potential risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviours when taking Ozempic-style drugs.

title.children: New warning for Ozempic-style drugs over risk of suicidal thoughts

image.altText: Bamboo scaffolding burns and falls to the ground from a high-rise apartment building

props.synopsis: Hong Kong's anti-corruption agency has arrested 13 people, including the directors and an engineering consultant of a construction company.

title.children: Netting on apartment complex did not meet fire resistance code, Hong Kong officials say
